name: Odinaldo Rodrigues
content: Odinaldo Rodrigues | King's College London Skip to main contentDr Odinaldo Rodrigues Reader in Artificial IntelligenceCo-Director of the UKRI Centre for Doctoral Training in Safe and Trusted AIResearch interestsComputer scienceContact details+44 020 7848 2087odinaldo.rodrigues@kcl.ac.ukBiographyDr. Odinaldo Rodrigues is a Reader in Artificial Intelligence and has published numerous articles and a couple of books in the areas of knowledge representation and reasoning, the formalisation of the common-sense reasoning, and argumentation theory. He is co-Director of the UKRI Centre for Doctoral Training in Safe and Trusted Artificial Intelligence, the executive editor of the Journal of Logic and Computation and of the Logic Journal of the IGPL, and programme committee member of all major international AI conferences. Research interests Artificial intelligence Argumentation Theory Knowledge Representation and Reasoning Neuro-Symbolic Techniques for Artificial Intelligence More information Research Profile Research Funding Personal Website PublicationsResearchResearchTrusted Autonomous Systems HubThe Trusted Autonomous Systems Hub develops the trustable autonomous systems of tomorrow. Health HubThe Health Hub centres on computational characterisation of medically relevant study cases and data. Reasoning and PlanningThe group focuses on the fundamental AI challenge of creating, representing and reasoning.
